thread.title: Prep No. 19 Simeon gets it together, defeats Curie
thread.title_full: Prep football: No. 19 Simeon gets it together, defeats Curie - Chicago Tribune

author: Steve Reaven
title: Prep No. 19 Simeon gets it together, defeats Curie
text:
Tactics didn't cause Simeon to come back from a two-touchdown halftime deficit against Curie on Friday at Gately Stadium.
According to the No. 19 Wolverines, coach Dante Culbreath's locker-room words were it took to turn the tide in their 33-21 CPS Red Bird win.
"He motivated us to play like we know we can play," Simeon quarterback Dakota Turner said. "It lit a fire under us and came out running on all cylinders."
The Wolverines, who are 32-0 in conference games since joining the Red Bird in 2009, were pushed around on both sides of the line in the first half while falling behind 14-0.
Turner went to the air in the second half, with his four touchdown passes taking advantage of Curie (4-1, 1-1) putting as many as 10 defenders in the box.
Turner also had a 39-yard scamper that set up Arkalius Howard's 1-yard plunge on the first play of the fourth quarter that gave the Wolverines the lead for good at 19-14.
Malik Holcomb was on the receiving end of three of Turner's second-half TD tosses. His 66-yard grab three plays into the third quarter got the Wolverines (3-2, 2-0) on the scoreboard, cutting the Condors' deficit to 14-6.
Prep football: No. 6 Joliet Catholic runs over No. 14 Marian Central Bob Narang Simplicity worked well for the Joliet Catholic offense Friday night.
Michael Johnson handled the majority of the rushing load, carrying the ball 32 times for 216 yards and three touchdowns to fuel No. 6 Joliet Catholic's 41-3 rout of No. 14 Marian Central at Memorial Stadium in Joliet.
In a mid-season...
Simplicity worked well for the Joliet Catholic offense Friday night.
Michael Johnson handled the majority of the rushing load, carrying the ball 32 times for 216 yards and three touchdowns to fuel No. 6 Joliet Catholic's 41-3 rout of No. 14 Marian Central at Memorial Stadium in Joliet.
In a mid-season...
(Bob Narang) The tandem hooked up from 29 yards out early in the fourth quarter to stretch Simeon's lead to 26-14, and a 70-yard connection in the game's final minute served as the exclamation point on a dominant effort.
"My coaches get on me every day about getting off the ball hard," said Holcomb, who also had four sacks on defense. "If the defender comes up to get a jam, they shouldn't be able to guard you downfield if you get off the ball. And that's what happened tonight."
Steve Reaven is a freelance reporter for the Chicago Tribune.
Player of the game: Malik Holcomb, Simeon, 5 receptions, 226 yards, 3 TDs; 4 sacks.
Key performers: Simeon — Dakota Turner, 7-for-13 passing, 234 yards, 4 TDs. Curie — Matthew Cole, 5 carries, 105 yards, TD.
